books.title: The Tempest
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A magic-induced tempest shipwrecks the king of Naples and his crew on an island inhabited by the usurped duke of Milan.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Autobiography of Ma-Ka-Tai-Me-She-Kia-Kiak, or Black Hawk
books.author: Black Hawk
books.summary: The autobiography of Black Hawk, the famous leader of the Native American Sauk tribe and central figure in the Black Hawk War of 1832.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Railway Children
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: After their father is forced to leave them, three children and their mother must live in near-poverty in the country, where their lives are enlivened by the nearby presence of a railway line.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: Henry IV, Part I
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry IV faces Welsh and Scottish rebels while English royals plot to betray their own king.

books.title: The Demi-Gods
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Three demi-gods descend among humanity in the form of angels, stumbling upon a father, his daughter, and their donkey traveling around rural Ireland.

books.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
books.author: Anthony Hope
books.summary: King Rudolph V of Ruritania is drugged and abducted on the eve of his coronation, and a gentleman on holiday who happens to look like the king has to stop the sinister plot.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.

books.title: The Murders in Praed Street
books.author: John Rhode
books.summary: An eccentric scientist investigates a series of shocking murders that terrorize London.

books.title: The Problems of Philosophy
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: A beginner’s guide to problems in various fields of philosophy.

books.title: Thus Spake Zarathustra
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: After ten years spent in solitude, Zarathustra goes back amongst men to share his accumulated wisdom and prepare humanity for the Overman.

books.title: North of Boston
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: A collection of Frost’s poetry.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: The Moon Maid
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young man travels to the moon with a group of companions and discovers that it’s inhabited; in subsequent centuries, reincarnations of the same man deal with an invasion of the Earth by the malevolent inhabitants of the Moon.

books.title: Short Science Fiction
books.author: Isaac Asimov
books.summary: A collection of short science fiction by Isaac Asimov, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
